Recipe.Description: Scampi is the (plural) Italian word for langoustine, a kind of very small lobster. It has come to be known as a style of dish using crustaceans such as shrimp, prawns and, of course, langoustines or langostinos (Spanish), or even lobster.

Prerequisites.Prerequisite: Find a shallow pan, large enough so that the shrimp may be placed in it in a single layer, or you can use individual dishes. Rub the pan(s) with butter.

Method.Step: Lay the shrimp in the pan, then add the wine, lemon juice and zest, garlic, salt, pepper, mace, parsley and green onion tops.
Cover the shrimp with thin slices of butter.
Bake at 350 for 10-15 minutes, until almost done, finish under broiler.

Variations.Variation: Scampi au gratin: Just before the shrimp are done, right before the broiling step, top with grated Parmesan.

Scampi รก la griglia: Season shrimp with salt, pepper and mace. Marinate shrimp in lemon juice w/minced garlic for 5-10 minutes. Saute garlic in butter briefly. Dip shrimp in garlic butter and roll them in bread crumbs before placing them in the cooking pan (they can also be done on skewers -good way to cook shrimp on a grill without totally drying them out). Sprinkle with parsley and green onion tops. Drizzle remaining butter overall. Broil 5-10 minutes, until bread crumbs are browned.
